ReportSection.name: Kickstart Program
ReportSection.title: Kickstart 2024 Application
ReportSection.Static:
This request for proposals seeks to support the creation of new companies (NewCo) as well as existing start-ups during their initial phase of development. Kickstart funds can be used for legal services, research and technology development, business development, and commercialization.

Requirements

The NewCo applicant must meet the following requirements:
  • Be engaged in developing a glycomics-based technology
  • Have technology that is protected by valid IP (licensable)
  • Provide a comprehensive business plan
  • Seek creation as a for-profit Canadian incorporated company
Or be an existing company that:
  • Has been incorporated for under 3 years
  • Has raised under $5M in external funding
  • Has a maximum of 10 employees

Funding Available

GlycoNet has set aside up to $200,000 for Kickstart Program for 2024 – 2025 (for 2-3 start-up companies). Proposals may request up to $100,000 in funding.

Funding terms will be negotiated on a case-by-case basis, depending on amount requested, funding sources, etc. Matching funds and co-investment are preferable, but may be not required.

Kickstart funds can be used for the following activities:
  • Legal Services:
    • IP filings and maintenance
    • Costs for incorporation
    • Licensing and partnership agreements
  • Research and Technology:
    • Salary support for key hires
    • Technology development and validation;
    • Outsourcing research
    • Manufacturing analysis and planning
  • Commercialization:
    • Business plan creation;
    • Business development
    • Financial strategy;
    • Regulatory strategy
    • Sales & marketing plan

Application Steps:

Step 1:
  • Submission of the Business Case, followed by a discussion with GlycoNet Management to review the opportunity, ensure alignment of goals, and discuss the funding details.
Step 2 (by invitation only):
  • Summary and preparation of a “Pitch Deck” outlining the detailed business plan.
  • Submission of the “Pitch Deck” followed by first presentation of the opportunity to the Commercialization Committee.
Step 3:
  • Detailed diligence review by GlycoNet and refinement of the business plan, including financial terms for funding.
  • Final presentation of the opportunity to the Commercialization Committee to approve funding.

You are only required to complete Step 1 – submitting the Business Case.

Deadline for Step 1:
Business Case – November 20, 2024 (must be submitted by midnight PDT).

Additional Information
Questions about this opportunity can be sent to info@glyconet.ca (cc sxanthoudakis@glyconet.ca and enanak@ualberta.ca).

ReportSection.name: Application
ReportSection.ReportItem:
You are only required to complete Step 1 – submitting the Business Case.

Download the Application Template

Elements of the Kickstart Business Case (2-3 Pages):

  • Company description: Overview of the business, including founders, management and structure
  • Core technology or service
    • What is the technology offering?
    • What specific need does the technology or service address?
    • How does the technology or service differentiate from existing solutions?
  • IP status: Summary of patent filings and strategy
  • Commercial Plan: Competition, market description (size, growth rate) and future market expansion
  • Financial plan: Funding needed to reach next major inflection point; timeline for spending and raising funds

Deadline for Step 1:
Business Case – November 20, 2024 (must be submitted by midnight PDT).

  • Use Times Roman/Times New Roman 11 for the text format
  • The application must be uploaded as a single PDF file to the GlycoNet Forum (after completing the application template, convert it to PDF format).

Application Upload
